comments.body:

> Still dependent on org.apache.parquet:parquet-hadoop-bundle:jar:1.8.1:compile and org.apache.parquet:parquet-hadoop:jar:1.10.1:provided

Yea I get it. When we refer a parquet class in the hive module it, how do we resolve it?

1. For sql/hive/src/main, only refer one Parquet class, and `ParquetOutputFormat.COMPRESSION` does not conflict: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/00d169156d4b1c91d2bcfd788b254b03c509dc41/sql/hive/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/hive/execution/HiveOptions.scala#L120
2. For sql/hive/src/test, although referred a lot of Parquet classes, but only here conflicts.
what do you mean by conflict? One version has this class but the other version does not?

No, both versions have the same class name, but they are not the same. E.g:

`org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetOutputFormat`. parquet 1.10.1 has JOB_SUMMARY_LEVEL, but parquet 1.8.1 does not have JOB_SUMMARY_LEVEL:

https://github.com/apache/parquet-mr/blob/apache-parquet-1.10.1/parquet-hadoop/src/main/java/org/apache/parquet/hadoop/ParquetOutputFormat.java#L131
https://github.com/apache/parquet-mr/blob/apache-parquet-1.8.1/parquet-hadoop/src/main/java/org/apache/parquet/hadoop/ParquetOutputFormat.java#L106
just for curiosity, what's the error message of the scala compiler when we refer to a parquet class that are different between these 2 versions?

```java
build/mvn clean package -Phadoop-3.2 -DskipTests=true
...
[info] Compiling 90 Scala sources and 17 Java sources to /home/yumwang/opensource/apache-spark/sql/hive/target/scala-2.12/test-classes...
[error] /home/yumwang/opensource/apache-spark/sql/hive/src/test/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/sources/ParquetHadoopFsRelationSuite.scala:127: value JOB_SUMMARY_LEVEL is not a member of object org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetOutputFormat
[error]         ParquetOutputFormat.JOB_SUMMARY_LEVEL -> "ALL",
[error]                             ^
[error] one error found
[error] Compile failed at Apr 17, 2019 6:14:45 AM [7.629s]
```
How do you know this is caused by conflict? Maybe it's because the sbt picks parquet-1.8 in the hive module?

Add `-verbose` to `scala-maven-plugin`:
```xml
<args>
  <arg>-unchecked</arg>
```

It shows loading `ParquetOutputFormat` from `parquet-hadoop-bundle-1.8.1.jar` instead of `parquet-hadoop-1.10.1.jar`:
```
[info] [loaded class file /root/.m2/repository/org/apache/parquet/parquet-hadoop-bundle/1.8.1/parquet-hadoop-bundle-1.8.1.jar(org/apache/parquet/hadoop/ParquetOutputFormat.class) in 8ms]
```
Is it possible to resolve to parquet-1.10 in the hive module?
Personally, I think it is feasible: https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/24346
